org.xbmc.httpapi.client

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xbmc.httpapi.client.Client
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    MusicClient, TvShowClient, VideoClient

    abstract class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Abstract super class of all (media) clients.
    Author:
    Team XBMC

    • Method Detail

      • getCover

        protected Bitmap getCover(INotifiableManager manager,
              ICoverArt cover,
              int size,
              java.lang.String url,
              java.lang.String fallbackUrl)
        Downloads a cover. Since base64-download is a REAL pita, we'll check for XBMC revision and dispatch to direct download via the /thumbs accessor if possible.
        Parameters:
        manager - Postback manager
        cover - Cover object
        size - Minmal size to pre-resize to.
        url - URL to primary cover
        fallbackUrl - URL to fallback cover
        Returns:
        Bitmap

      • getCoverFromLibGoAhead

        private Bitmap getCoverFromLibGoAhead(INotifiableManager manager,
                            ICoverArt cover,
                            int size,
                            java.lang.String url,
                            java.lang.String fallbackUrl)
        Downloads a cover "the old way", meaning the base64-encoded result is stored in a String and decoded from there. I've tried using a Base64.InputStream directly with libgoahead crashing as a result.
        Parameters:
        manager - Postback manager
        cover - Cover object
        size - Minmal size to pre-resize to.
        url - URL to primary cover
        fallbackUrl - URL to fallback cover
        Returns:
        Bitmap

      • getCoverFromMicroHTTPd

        private Bitmap getCoverFromMicroHTTPd(INotifiableManager manager,
                            ICoverArt cover,
                            int size,
                            java.lang.String url,
                            java.lang.String fallbackUrl)
        Downloads a cover using microhttpd. First, only boundaries are downloaded in order to determine the sample size. Setting sample size > 1 will do two things:
        1. Only a fragment of the total size will be downloaded
        2. Resizing will be smooth and not pixelated as before
        There is no base64-decoding since we're accessing the /thumb accessor directly. The returned size is the next bigger (but smaller than the double) size of the original image.
        Parameters:
        manager - Postback manager
        cover - Cover object
        size - Minmal size to pre-resize to.
        url - URL to primary cover
        fallbackUrl - URL to fallback cover
        Returns:
        Bitmap

      • prefetch

        private BitmapFactory.Options prefetch(INotifiableManager manager,
                             java.lang.String url,
                             int size)
        Only downloads as much as boundaries of the image in order to find out its size.
        Parameters:
        manager - Postback manager
        url - URL to primary cover
        size - Minmal size to pre-resize to.
        Returns:

      • prefetch

        private BitmapFactory.Options prefetch(INotifiableManager manager,
                             byte[] data,
                             int size)
        Only decodes as much as boundaries of the image in order to find out its size.
        Parameters:
        manager - Postback manager
        data - Image data as byte array
        size - Minmal size to pre-resize to.
        Returns:

      • blowup

        private Bitmap blowup(Bitmap source)
        Doubles the size of a bitmap and re-reads it with samplesize 2. I've found no other way to smoothely resize images with samplesize = 1.
        Parameters:
        source -
        Returns:
